website_summaries.verdict: A popular option that comes complete with the Arthritis Foundation’s stamp of approval. Highly affordable and, in most cases, surprisingly effective, although they do conceal a minor design flaw.
pros: Engineered by an orthopedic surgeon, these gloves provide mild compression and warmth for improved circulation and pain management
Soft and breathable fabric is suitable for all day use
cons: The tag is positioned on the inside and may cause irritation
A few owners feel they're too loose around the wrist

customer_reviews.title: NON refundable!
customer_reviews.text: even though I measured my hand precisely as the box states, the gloves were too small and actually hurt them. Mostly because of the bulky seams that left huge dents in on my fingers and hands. I feel that compression gloves should be close to seamless as to not cause irritation. The item is NON REFUNDABLE so know that prior to purchase. They did give me $5 back. But I wasn't impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Compression and Warmth Makes All the Difference in Pain Levels
customer_reviews.text: My arthritic hands ache endlessly in damp or cold weather. When my 98 year old aunt said she hand washes dishes so that the warm water will soothe her aching hands, I knew this was the gift for her. She usually gets angry at gifts I send. A gift card is the worst offender. But these gloves, she adores. The Arthritis Association endorses these. The combination of compression and warmth makes all the difference in pain levels with no side effects. The open fingers allow for sensing, picking up, and holding items skillfully while the hands are warmed and soothed. I am a retired RN [and therapist] and strongly endorse these. My auntie likes them. Case closed.
customer_reviews.author: Observer One

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE THESE GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness...what a difference these have made for my arthritic/trigger finger hands. Just by wearing them during non-work hours I have notice tremendous relief. I did not have a need to return to my rheumatologist who recommended them :-) There were a bit tight at first but glad I stayed with my original size as they streatched out a tiny bit and became comfortable - a little pressure actually feels good and they keep my hands warm for good circulation. They are super soft and I cannot say enough about them. Able to wear them while sewing, too. BUY THEM WITH CONFIDENCE.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaM

customer_reviews.title: Buy these gloves only if you like mending
customer_reviews.text: After spending time mending a second pair of these gloves, I decided to write a review. I liked these gloves because the fingers are long and do provide support and warmth, so when the first pair was ruined, I ordered a second, which quickly when the way of the first. The ends of the fingers are not hemmed, just over stitched; the stitching is rather loose and quickly rip apart. Also the seams frequently split and the knit material unravels. Maybe they last if all one does while wearing them is read a book.
customer_reviews.author: marafish

customer_reviews.title: These are very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis as well as osteoarthritis. It’s the osteo- that gives me the most discomfort right now, so I ordered these compression gloves. I measured as instructed and ordered size small. I washed them in a lingerie bag and dried them on a drying rack, hoping they’d shrink a bit, since there’s not much compression in them. Today, after wearing them maybe five times, I discovered a hole at about the wrist area. Not in a seam, either.
customer_reviews.author: Uh-oh 123

customer_reviews.title: Too small, not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my Dad who has suffered with RA for more than 20 years. They are far too small for a man's hands! I came back to see if perhaps I had ordered a "female" pair, but no, just the regular large. I could barely pull them down on my fingers and they are so small my Dad can't even get his finger tips through. This is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Soosai

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware unless you have skinny fingers.
customer_reviews.text: After careful consideration I purchased the medium in these cloves even though measurements were compatible with a small .... specifically because I didn’t want the glove too tight in the hand and fingers. While I think these would provide some comfort for my wrist which has undergone 6 surgeries, sadly they were so tight on my fingers they were losing circulation. I have a proportionately sized hand/wrist/finger diameter and every other glove I have purchased has been fine as well as the surgical gloves I use. However, not these! Since you can’t return them I really wish I had gone to a cheaper option.
customer_reviews.author: VetRad

customer_reviews.title: Caused numbiing went by size chart no returns
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time yesterday tried them this am , they cause numbing and cut off circulation ,the seam inside causes discomfort and there are no returns allowed so be aware when you order these if they do not work for you , you will be unable to return or get a refund .
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable -low quality junk not recommended for purchase
customer_reviews.text: Ordered new from Amazon, on the second day the entire thumb came off of the right hand glove, half the stitching was falling apart in most of the remaining fingers, strings loose on every finger. The company returned my money no issue, but Amazon permits them to continue to sell this low quality junk (IMHO) to its valued customers The unfortunate issue is these are very comfortable gloves, but come on $12 every 2 days for gloves, come on source a quality product or stop selling it on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: OnTheMountain

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic, post-op and injured hands!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for hand/wrist/finger Arthritis sufferers, post-op and injuries. I had borrowed a glove from a friend and loved it so much, I ordered a pair so I could return hers. I hand wash them. They are durable, comfortable, I like the darker color and the compression is ideal for sore hands/wrists/fingers. (The way they fit, it's a bit difficult to do super fine motor skills. The fingers almost reach to the tips, which can make fine movements a bit harder. They aren't made for that anyway.) They are worth it all. The price is super reasonable. I have tried and been prescribed all sorts of hand orthopedics and these are the best ever!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... fingers is what I bought this product for is great the inside tags sewed into the wrist area are ...
customer_reviews.text: while the compression in the fingers is what I bought this product for is great the inside tags sewed into the wrist area are frustratingly itchy. I have to curl the wrist part up because even after cutting out the tags what is left within the seem is still irritating my wrists as I move about. It would be awesome and I'd be willing to pay a few bucks more had these been tag-less. Edit to add my mom is going to try a seam ripper to pull out the tags, if you have one of those that might do the trick :)
customer_reviews.author: Kellyn Hartley

customer_reviews.title: one of the best recommendations I have ever gotten
customer_reviews.text: I have Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, and because of that, I have Osteoarthritis in my hands at 35 years of age. I'm a writer. I have been in support groups for a few years, and gotten tons of adaptive equipment recommendations... this was, by far, one of the best recommendations I have ever gotten! My fingers are long and narrow, with larger interphalangeal and metacarpophalangeal joints. I got the small. The compression is a bit tight over the palm itself, but perfect in the fingers, which is where I really need it for typing and fine motor coordination. I tried Tommie Copper, and at least 4 other types of arthritic and/or compression gloves... save yourself... BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Just Ali

customer_reviews.title: Run small, non refundable
customer_reviews.text: These gloves run small and the seams leave dents in your hands. I wore them for 10 minutes and felt like i was losing circulation in my hands. Material isnt great either. NON REFUNDABLE. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Casciano

customer_reviews.title: I think I would order them again.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a small based on measurements as previous reviews recommended (do NOT include your thumb). So it fit perfectly. It fits snugly but as others have suggested, I feel the fingers are a little long. Rather than cut them since they are nicely reinforced at the tips, I just fold them back one time. It is comfortable although after a little while, its a little too warm to keep on. I sleep with them and I think it reduces the pain somewhat but not as much as I would like. But it does keep the swelling down which is most important. I like having the open fingers so I can type and do other things.
customer_reviews.author: susan b.

customer_reviews.title: Total pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I was told my hand therapist that I needed to get some to help with my pain in my hands. I have AR. When I take them off I ice my hands. It makes a big difference. I highly recommend them. I can still feel things since it has no fingertips. You need to make sure that you get the right size. If you get them to small you will be in pain. I tried them on at my hand therapist's office.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Logue

customer_reviews.title: Helps some
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product a 3 star rating as the gloves were defective. The seller did send me another pair which was also defective in almost the same area as the first pair. As far as pain relief so far they have helped calm some of the pain in my hands. I have Raynauds and it has helped some except for the part of my fingers that are out of the gloves. That area at times feels worse than when I am not wearing the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: The seams are very painful
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves in hopes of helping the nerve damage from neuropathy and CRPS, as well as the arthritis in my hands. However, the seams on the inside were really painful, especially the seam on the thumbs. That seam is especially large. I have worn the gloves twice now (for only one or two hours each time) and the seam on a couple of of the fingers is already separating apart. I wanted really bad to give a good review, but even more so, to find gloves that would help. But unfortunately, these gloves have caused me additional pain.
customer_reviews.author: SassyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is WRONG and seller has no return policy
customer_reviews.text: I have rather small hands but got the medium size just in case. I've purchased this brand before and the medium was perfect. I don't know what happened with the manufacturing but the gloves were more like an extra small. I could barely get them over my hand. I wanted to return these but now I'm told I can't return them because of the seller's policy. They weren't sold through Amazon. So now I've just spent money for nothing. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: K9LivesMatter

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart at the seam in less than 24 hours....
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to getting these gloves. I used for 5 hours last night. Then wore again for three hours during the day today. I just looked down and noticed that the seam is coming apart. Maybe I just received a pair that wasn't stitched very well. They feel good, But the only Big drawback is that the seam is coming apart after only owning them for less than 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turn them inside-out to earn 4 stars.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 64 year old Male with arthritis and swelling issues in both hands. I did not consider these gloves comfortable until I wore them inside-out; thereby putting the seams outside rather then against my skin. I ordered the X-large gloves, only because there wasn’t an XX-Large option. I typically wear XX-large motorcycle and cycling gloves, however I was pleased...these fit well. I wore them for the first time last night and was surprised my typical morning swelling and stiffness was greatly reduced. This morning, I could close my fists tightly and almost completely. I’m sold...and you should be too.
customer_reviews.author: WC

customer_reviews.title: IMAK Compression Arthritis Gloves
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth pair of these gloves that I have bought in medium. Last night was the first time I tried to wear them to bed to relieve the pain in my hands. This pair is way too small and cut off the circulation to my fingers. I have had them too long to send back. Four pairs were excellent and this brand has longed fingers to cover all the joints that hurt. My warning is to try them when you get them and don't get stuck like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jones

customer_reviews.title: A bit too small
customer_reviews.text: Rating could be higher if gloves were just a little more stretchy (I bought Size: Small. Secondly, I think they could be lower in cost (eg: There is no need for the box and packaging design & printing costs because these are not bought off the shelf. These could be packaged in a cheap zip baggie with a small sticker/label on it. Savings should be passed on to the consumer. At $17. these are pricy.
customer_reviews.author: daisy376

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves. Undependable sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the gloves to help reduce lymphatic swelling in my hand. They came very promptly. I like them and they have helped. But - in the 3 pairs I bought, the sizing is a joke. I carefully measured my hand according to the directions. I first bought a small by mistake - so I quickly ordered a medium. The medium is actually tighter than the small. The only thing larger is that the fingers are longer. So I ordered a second pair of size small in order to be able to wash one and have time for it to dry. Odd sizing - but very helpful glove.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Small size is not small enough, measurements not completely accurate
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated that these could not be returned, when small size( is actually larger than described) when I measured it for my hand prior and actually is still too large. My hands aren’t the smallest hands up there. Frustrated these could not be returned for the right size. Since they are not returnable. Measurements on the website or in accurate. Even though my knuckles measure the right distance the fingers are not tight enough.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly effective
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the gloves seems to be OK, I have not had any issues with tearing or bad seams like some of the other reviews mention. I have worn them for several hours at a time and worn them to bed. The fabric is comfortable. However, the gloves do not provide much in the way of compression for your hand, just your fingers. There is no compression in the part that covers the palm which is where my arthritis pain primarily is. The gloves don't do much for me other than cut off some of the circulation to my fingertips. But they may provide some relief if your pain is in your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Practical

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several pairs of gloves sold at the local "big box" store... they develop holes much quicker than I would like. I have two very nice Tommy Copper gloves, one is full fingers and the other is a half finger. The IMAK is in the middle, so perfect for what I am using them for... plus these are a heavier material (warmer). The IMAK are solid gloves. I see people posting pictures of gloves with seams open and some unraveling. My advice is to trim the "nits" instead of pulling them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy stitching
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work, and they do so as intended, save for the fact that the finger-lengths are a bit off, but dear god they have the worst stitching. A small seam on each glove popped within a week, and they've just been growing and tearing since then. I use for typing, so it's not like I'm putting them under extreme stress or anything. They still work for now, but every day they disintegrate a little bit more. If they were cheaper, I don't think I would mind so much, but I'm annoyed that I'm going to have to buy a new pair (definitely not this brand) in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Measured hand, matching size is too small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the medium based on my hand width. The hand part of the glove is a little too small -- the fingers are way too tight. I had to really shove to get the fingers down onto my hand, and it felt like the hems at the top were cutting off my circulation. I'd exchange it for a large, but Amazon says it cannot be returned. I chatted with their customer service bot, and they did give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Tolana

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing I suppose
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend these. I measured and ordered a small, which actually fits, even though I take a large or extra-large in women's gloves. While they fit, they did fit a bit more loosely than I wanted and the compression seemed OK, but a bit weak. I imagine if you wear a medium or small in women's gloves, the size small would be far too big. As it is, the thumbs are too big and do not offer any compression at all. Also. the glove stretches out quickly. After a little more than a month of wearing them only while I sleep, they were feeling noticeably larger and offering less compression.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good compression, bad make.
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these gloves because they work great for controlling the swelling and pain in my hands, but... I've only had them for about six weeks and they're falling apart. First hole appeared in the palm of the right glove, then another in the index finger of the left, followed by another another the thumb seam. I've only washed them twice, in cold water, and air dried. After reading other reviews, pethaps I got a defective pair?
customer_reviews.author: Julia G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hand surgery recovery
customer_reviews.text: My spouse recently had hand surgery and these IMAX gloves provided the extra compression he needed during recovery. They helped reduce post-op pain and facilitated his daily exercises by keeping his hand warm for better movement. The quality of construction is top-notch and the finger openings allow for ease-of-use when keyboarding or performing other tasks. I bought a pair for myself to use while walking the dog. They keep my hands warm, but don't limit motion. Great gloves if you don't have medical needs, too!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis. I also type a lot. Obviously, finger joint pain is an issue. I gave these a try out of desperation and I'm glad I did. The compression is enough that it supports my joints and reduces pain, but not so much that they're uncomfortable. And the fabric is thin, so it doesn't impede my ability to type. Another unexpected bonus is that, if I'm working on photo editing, the gloves provide a nice barrier between my hands and my touchscreen. All in all, these were a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Farey

customer_reviews.title: Such a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis and some days my hands are useless because of pain and stiffness. Someone mentioned I should try gloves. After looking around a bit I settled on these. When they arrived they were so soft, I thought "these aren't going to help me." I couldn't have been more wrong. They have made such a difference for me. I'm so glad I found them. They are extremely soft and comfortable. I suggest everyone give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: If your hands hurt these are worth a look.
customer_reviews.text: So these are great gloves that seem to do exactly what they advertise. They are definitely worth a try if you suffer from arthritis or have pain in your hands from overuse at computer workstations or other strenuous activities. Only issue I have is the interior labels. After awhile they start to become uncomfortable. I would recommend removing the interior labels or wearing the gloves inside out if they bother you too after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: and got so bad that it would take me 5-10 minutes just to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ever since the beginning of 2016, I suddenly had a pain in my fingers. It would start the moment I woke up, and got so bad that it would take me 5-10 minutes just to be able to flex my fingers. If I didn't use/flex my fingers after a while, it would again stiffen up. After using these gloves, I immediately felt some relief. It's been only a few days, but while I still have some joint/bone pain, my muscle stiffness has been greatly relieved and I have regained flexibility in my fingers. One thing that I never realized before using the gloves was how swollen my fingers were. Once using the gloves, my fingers were noticeably thinner.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Hiker and ProspectorTop Contributor: Hiking

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT for Raynauds
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT for Raynauds!!! From the moment I put on these gloves I could feel the effect. With Raynauds, the blood runs out of my fingers and they get cold and stiff and hurt a lot. These gloves are so snug and massage my hands. You can actually see the blood flush down to my finger tips and my fingers feel sooooo good and warm. I cant believe i never knew about these before because i've been suffering so much for so long. i also bought another pair by a different manufacturer but these are much much better. i'm going to buy another pair so i'll have one at home and one at work.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL  in, Miami FL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find something that will help me with my arthritis and these gloves are doing the trick. they are not too tight or loose, they give me enough compression to help take away the pain from the day. I am an executive assistant so I am always typing and at the end of the day, they hurt so bad. When I put on the gloves, he takes all that away and they are extremely soft. Love this product, very happy that I got them..
customer_reviews.author: Mary Keating

customer_reviews.title: Wear them inside-out & one size larger
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I read the other reviews first. I ordered one size bigger than my PT recommended. It’s tight. The pain that it causes my fingers allows me only to wear them for about 90 minutes to 2 hours. I am trying to reduce swelling from a broken wrist. I do not have arthritis issues. Here is a thee big key to having these feel better on your hands...WEAR THEM INSIDE-OUT!
customer_reviews.author: Active Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Really helps arthritic finger pain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after reading about them in Arthritis Today magazine. My fingers and thumb joint are very painful sometimes and especially at night. My routine is that I put cannabis balm (no THC) on first and then put on my glove before I go to sleep. They are very comfortable to wear while sleeping and I do think my fingers feel better when I wear them. I read that they run big and I bought a Small...just tight enough to feel comfortable and do the job. Follow the measurement guide if you are unsure. It's what I used. Also, I have washed and dried them a few times and they come out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: chrissj

customer_reviews.title: Beware the price is for a single glove
customer_reviews.text: I misread the description and thought this was for two PAIRS of gloves not just two gloves. I also measured my hand and ordered a size medium as indicated on the chart. This glove is so tight my hand starts to feel numb in seconds. I am not sure I can continue to wear the gloves in order to stretch them to be comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I messed up and ordered a small instead of a medium so I have to reorder but I have used these gloves for years now. They are a true LIFE SAVER and a must for Arthritis!! I sleep in them, and literally don't know what I would do without these! I've had many others order these who suffer and they say the same thing. Thank you for making these, I will never be without them!
customer_reviews.author: misha

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have both arthritis and fibromyalgia and bought this compression glove to help relieve pain in the knuckles and the joints on my fingers. Though I think the glove helped ease the pain a little, it is very comfortable to wear because of the tags on the inside of each glove. The tags caused itching and a slight rash on me. I don't understand why there needs to be a tag on the inside of the glove. Just plain dumb. I tried returning the item but apparently this seller does not accept returns. Beware, no returns allowed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought these 3 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased for poor circulation due to Raynaud's. Over the years, I have worn them for arthritis, tendinitis, trigger finger. Last night, I saw an ad for compression gloves on TV & looked them up. I don't need new gloves. These IMAK gloves still provide me with the relief I need for my 74 year old hands after 3 years of throwing them in the washer & dryer!
customer_reviews.author: SKiety

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical when I received this produc. But I was very pleased after only 5 minutes after I tried it on. It fits very snugly into your hands. It does not put a lot of pressure in your hands, it does not make your hands sweaty or swollen, the fabric is very soft and elastic. I really love this product it's extremely comfortable it provides light pressure that in somehow relieves joint pain. I'm planning to wear them at the gym when I'm working out.. I highly recommend these gloves they are really outstanding.. if you suffer from arthritis pain in your hands these gloves will provide light comfort
customer_reviews.author: Jorge L. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Listen, they seem to help, but for the price of these compared to some others on Amazon, I expected an uptick in quality. Here's the straight truth: Save your money and buy the cheapest gloves you can find. They are tight fabric gloves with cheap seams, period. I've had them on for an hour and already the top of one of the fingers is fraying and the seam on one of the pinkie fingers is fraying, as well. As others have noted, there's a no returns policy with these, so caveat emptor. Luckily for you, the reader of this review, I can help you save ~$10 by going with the cheapest model you can find!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kulwicki

customer_reviews.title: Questioning the quality; they ripped the first time I put them on
customer_reviews.text: I was careful to size these gloves according to the instructions and they seem to fit and compares the way I would expect. I was also careful when I first put them on, but the left hand glove ripped open right at the tag. Pretty disappointed in the quality. I was expecting better than this.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Harlow

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware? These are NOT returnable.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both med and large because although I measured less that 3 1/2”, I wasn’t sure. I couldn’t get the mediums on at all! The large fit, but the seams were so uncomfortable I knew I wouldn’t wear them. I wanted to return them the same day, only to find out they are not returnable. I wish that would be in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Ave Fairfield

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me. No problem with quality.
customer_reviews.text: My hands don't hurt anymore... Last few months a new problem cropped up for me. Aching hands too sore to hold a cup of coffee, mornings in general I'd wake up with painful joints. I assumed it was arthritis, my grandmother had debilitating rheumatoid arthritis. Made her hands deformed. Don't want that. These gloves made my hands feel better within a few days of use. Perfect fit, ordering more so I can rotate out daily to clean ones.
customer_reviews.author: sitatara

customer_reviews.title: Getting Cold Fingers
customer_reviews.text: Longer than expected. These cover my hands like normal gloves so I'll have to sew the tips closed or cut it down to size. This goes for the wrist area too. I notice it would bunch around my wrist and I keep having to pull it back up my wrist. They do take some getting used to, but works as expected. Since they are finger-less gloves, the tips of my fingers would get cold faster since they do not have the compression of the gloves. It's the same as cutting circulation off and my fingers start to turn purple after a while. This upsets me as they boast about promoting circulation and help prevent cold hands.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Love em.
customer_reviews.text: When I'd wake up in am I could barely close my hand. I could not hold my coffee cup by handle. I wear these at night, wake up, and I can actually use my hands! Love these! My hands feel so much better
customer_reviews.author: Christina Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, weirdly cut, not great material
customer_reviews.text: I have a few pairs of compression gloves and these by far run the smallest which for me, is incredibly painful. The finger holes are cut at a weird length so if you’re an apple user and use your pointer finger, you’ll need to cut it yourself. The material is thicker than most and not really breatheable. I wouldn’t recommend this product. I’m probably going to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: They are much smaller than expected and NOT returnable!
customer_reviews.text: Arthritis compression gloves. I weigh 125 lbs and have bony, skinny fingers (from rheumatoid arthritis}. A size Medium was so tight, I started losing feeling in my fingertips after only 2 minutes. Tried to exchange for a larger size, only to find out they are NOT ELIGIBLE FOR RETURN! Very, very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: I love these but...
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! I will buy these gloves again~! I have 'OA' in my hands badly, and these gloves are the best gloves I have found to wear inside while going about my daily life. So, why only two stars? I am buying my third pair in 19 months. I do not get the chance to 'wear' these out. The stitching comes apart, ruining the gloves, and of course I can't sew with my hands, so I have to buy replacements My current pair I have never even washed, yet the entire thumb piece is coming off due to broken stitching. - without this issue, these would be a five star product!
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate sizing and NO returns
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these before in a size Small. I lost my gloves and ordered another pair. This pair is much larger and doesn’t fit at all. They DON’T offer returns? Wtf? I just wasted $20 on a product that i can’t use. I’m really upset.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke ohsman

customer_reviews.title: Split immediately
customer_reviews.text: My right hand is somewhat swollen following an accident. The gloves arrived today and, when I tried the right one on, it split down the seam opposite my thumb. My hand is 1/4" narrower than the size I ordered, so that should not be an issue as they are designed to stretch. Logged on to return them, only to be told they were non-returnable due to hygiene considerations. Customer service were able to solve this by giving me a refund anyway, and check that neither of the other two pairs from different manufacturers which I was ordering were non-returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie

customer_reviews.title: Look no further...
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around on amazon for lots of arthritic gloves. Decided to try out the economical pair and glad I did. Nice fabric, well made and provides comfort with good compression and warmth. Would definitely repurchase and will likely pick up a second pair to have on hand....yep. That was an unintended pun too good to take out.
customer_reviews.author: Joketown

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, even if they don't seem to help with arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Got for my mom to try and help with her arthritis in hands. It makes a weird cold sensation in hands that isn't unpleasant. After having them for a while, doesn't seem to make a difference in the arthritis, but they're nice gloves none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Deeanna

customer_reviews.title: These are small enough for my petite hands!
customer_reviews.text: I searched extensively for compression gloves that are tight enough to compress my hands sufficiently, and these ended up fitting perfectly! In fact, the first time I put them on, my fingertips starting turning a bit purple, and I took them off, thinking they were actually too tight. They did loosen up after that initial wear though, and now I wear them overnight after days when my hands ache from knitting. They always feel much better the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Vi Ferris

customer_reviews.title: They really help
customer_reviews.text: I love them. They don't work miracles but I wore them for the first time last night and was able to sleep pain free. My left hand I have trigger finger, my right severe carpal tunnel. The gloves don't offer too much support but they do help. Be sure to order size correctly, I ordered a small and they fit perfectly and my hands are kinda large for a woman
customer_reviews.author: Poetic B

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my mom--She seems to like them!
customer_reviews.text: I went home to visit during these COVID-y times and when I got there my Mom's thumb joints were noticeably swollen. She gardens every day and has arthritis. I saw that these were recommended by the Arthritis Foundation so I purchased them for her. She wore them the rest of the time I was there. Said that she felt like they helped. She could move easily and the swelling went down and reduced her pain.
customer_reviews.author: officeworker2007

customer_reviews.title: not even compression for much pain relief
customer_reviews.text: though I used the appropriate measurements for sizing these are not really much "compression" and I was hoping for a bit more. however they are very comfortable and I'll still use but in different ways than I had planned.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Helpful
customer_reviews.text: While these don't vastly improve my arthritis condition, they don't hurt either. You cant expect to be healed by a set of gloves however I believe that the slight compression does aid toward improving my comfort and circulation. Nothing voodoo like copper threads being applied here folks. I'd compare it to wearing a warm set of plush socks in the evening on a cool winter evening. Comfy cozy, nice and toasty. My hands love me for it and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: SteveS

customer_reviews.title: Loose on wrists, and hole in seam
customer_reviews.text: Two reasons for the three stars: One, they fit well through the fingers but are not tight enough around my wrists. It could be that my wrists are narrow for my hand size (medium), but they are loose (literally not form fitting, let alone tight). Second: there is a hole on the seam of the right glove, which appeared literally on the third wearing, and these are apparently not eligible for return. We will see about that.
customer_reviews.author: Allie484

customer_reviews.title: Great product - Good price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves a year ago and use them most nights. I have limited, typical, old-age arthritis like most 70 year olds. My arthritis is minimal and I only need to take a single Aleve every once in a while. With that as background, I find these gloves to be very helpful allowing me to awake without tightness or soreness. I wash my hands before bed and wear the gloves 5-7 nights weekly, on average. I then throw them into a standard batch of clothes washing and drying and they come out great, without any shrinkage or damage for the past year of usage. I see no reason why they wouldn't last another 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sutliff

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on seam when putting on for the first time.
customer_reviews.text: I have severe arthritis, so I purchase the IMAK and Comfybrace compression gloves. They were both highly rated. The Comfybrace gloves arrived 3 day quicker than the IMAKs. I purchased both in size medium. The correct size for me. The Comfybraces have a 100% return policy. The IMAKs have a no return policy. I've worn the Comfybraces several nights now and they're excellent. The IMAKs were less expensive, albeit they ripped on the seam the first time I tried them on. I went on Amazon to start a return and discovered the IMAKs are NOT returnable. That's a first for me on Amazon. The IMAKs are now in the trash and I am purchasing a second pair of Comfybraces.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I don't have arthritis, but I am thin and probably have poor circulation in my hands. Any time it would be 72 or below, my fingers would feel ice cold and would ache. I would have to turn the heater on in the summer because I sit under a vent. These have really helped keep them a bit warmer and my fingers don't hurt me like they used too. They aren't super thick so my hands don't get hot. I am still getting used to typing with them on, but they don't hinder me too bad. I am really glad I bought these. I was at the top end of the small size, but they fit without being too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Fireash

customer_reviews.title: Too small and can't return - Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The idea of the gloves were great but they were too small. I measured my hand and per the size chart ordered accordingly but when they came in, they were too small. I could barely put them on! Ordered a small and per the size chart, I was under 3". Buyer beware as you can't return or exchange them for a bigger size. I will not be ordering from here again. I found cheaper ones and they have a return policy so I will probably end up doing that.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I like the gloves very much I started slow wore them for short periods on day one. I slept with them last night and my hands felt so much less painful than usual. The black threads on the fingertips fray but as another reviewer recommended I used a lighter and they look great now.
customer_reviews.author: Kitt Fairy

customer_reviews.title: I bought these gloves in small and they felt great, but because I have Reynaud's it was too ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves in small and they felt great, but because I have Reynaud's it was too much compression for me and my fingertips turned ice cold. So I am returning them (easy peasy process) and exchanging for mediums. I can't wait to get them. They felt so good and will not only help with joint pain but keeping my hands warm. I also purchased a pair of the gloves with copper in them, but in large, and they did not have enough compression. I did measure my hand and order accordingly, but if you have any circulation issues, you will need to take that into consideration while ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Feel great and supportive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of compression gloves and I'm not sure what to expect. I do love how they feel, firm and comfy and slightly tight. I'm hoping they will minimize my thumb weakness and help me do more without discomfort. I liked these enough to buy another pair to keep at work at my desk job, I have smaller hands and they cover 3/4's of each fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Reeds

customer_reviews.title: size runs small. otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: sizing is incorrect. I measured my hand at 2 3/4", so I order a small. Way too tight. I also noticed that it looks exactly like the other one under different brand name (Dr. Goldberg's) but at cheaper price. So I ordered the other one and a medium size, and it is perfect. The product itself is just I want. Something long enough to cover all 3 joints of my fingers to keep them warm and still allow me to type, as I works on computer all day.
customer_reviews.author: a home owner

customer_reviews.title: Helps with my neuropathy
customer_reviews.text: I have real bad peripheral neuropathy in my hands. I needed something so that I would be able to continue using my phone and tablet. Searched around and decided to give these a try. They work very well, they protect the neuropathy from touching anything. Also they are not too hot and the grip in them is nice and firm but not too tight. The only complaint I have is for some reason the ring finger and the thumb are cut a lot shorter and therefore do not protect those areas.
customer_reviews.author: RFuller

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a slowly progressive neuromuscular disease, and yeah, probably some arthritis thrown in. Anyway the muscles in my hands are seriously atrophied, though still usable, but to put it simply --- they ache all the time. The IMAK arthritis gloves ease the pain, it's as simple as that. I've tried less expensive ones that look similar, but they just don't work as well. I keep rubber gloves handy to slip on if I'm working in the kitchen so I don't have to remove them. When they need washing I just toss them in with a load of clothes. Love these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne H.

customer_reviews.title: Big change since my previous set -- should have been identical
customer_reviews.text: I have an earlier pair of these gloves from the same manufacturer, same size small. These are not nearly as nice a fabric, don't have the little nubby bits on the fingers and palms (which I love), and are considerably smaller. I will be looking for a different source for my compression gloves for arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: DecaturJ

customer_reviews.title: Non Returnable Beware
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. I ordered two different brands to compare and decided to return this one but when I clicked to return it the message stated it was not returnable. I did not see any statement to that effect before ordering and there is a very uncomfortable tag sewn on the inside of the glove that is not removable without ruining the glove. Sorry I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Bing

customer_reviews.title: Size chart is inaccurate and NON-REFUNDABLE!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of size! XLarge is equivalent to a Medium. And these gloves are NON-REFUNDABLE! I measured my hand width at the knuckles as the instructions states, measuring at 3.75" width, I purchased the XL; as the size chart states it fits up to 4.5". I could not get the gloves over my palms and internal seams in the fingers are thick and bulky. I realize compression gloves are to be snug/tight but you should at least be able to pull them on over your palms. I am very disappointed with the inaccurate sizing and return policy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pain Relief For Hurting Hands
customer_reviews.text: I like the material, it’s not too thick or bulky. I like to sleep in these gloves, they do help relieve my pain from Rheumatoid Arthritis. The fingers are open so you can type or use the remote easy. I chose the grey gloves, they look nice to wear out if needed. I drive in these gloves, on painful days. I highly recommend for pain relief because they work. My support group friends like them as well.
customer_reviews.author: butterscotch

customer_reviews.title: Get two pairs in case you lose one!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are snug and feel very good. I don’t have arthritis but I do have nerve pain and the compression feels soooo good, and unlike some gloves they extend just over the top knuckle, which is necessary if your pain extends above the knuckle, as mine does. But fingertips are clear and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Murch

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect❣️
customer_reviews.text: I got concerned when I took them out of their package thinking, "Oh no, I got the wrong size." They just looked too small. I was wrong and the sizing chart was right. 🤣 They were a perfect fit and they feel so good. I never would have guessed compression gloves could provide such relief, but they really do. I never want to be with out these gloves again. I love them❣️
customer_reviews.author: C. J.

customer_reviews.title: not sure about this
customer_reviews.text: They did not work for me i wanted to return to get money back but they don't take returns i guess they actually made my pain worse 🙃 💔
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gordon

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a chef and has REALLY sore and swollen hands by the end of the workday. The first time he wore these after getting home I heard an audible sigh. He wears them when not work, and they are on the moment he gets home. It's been a few weeks and they've held up to the beating they get with doing things around the house. He's taken to wearing these when grocery shopping as well. He swears these must be crafted by magic or something because now he can use his hands without wincing. No seam tears, no loss in elasticity, and we fully intend to buy another pair for him to wear at work.
customer_reviews.author: NayNay

customer_reviews.title: Sizes are very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the same size that I have others. They were 2 different sizes and the closer fitting one was still tight. The other one was probably at least 2 sizes smaller..i just went back to the original I had purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable MILD Compression Gloves Recommended
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable and help a little with pain. They are listed as mild compression which is absolutely correct. What mislead me were the reviews. I have moderate to severe arthritis and while I find them comfortable and enjoy wearing them, they do not relieve pain but provide support.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Relief!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Imak brand are the ones to buy. I am near 65 and have arthritis and pseudo gout in both hands’ thumb/wrist joints. I got the medium and they are exactly right. Perfect amount of light compression and not tight feeling. Just feel supportive. I sleep in these now and have 75% less pain in the morning. I wear them during day when pain acts up or when doing something that support for those joints helpful. Just make sure to measure and get correct size for you.
customer_reviews.author: book buyer

customer_reviews.title: Life Savers
customer_reviews.text: I have severe carpal tunnel in both wrist that has affected all my fingers. I am a crafty person who was not able to Wire wrapped handmade jewelry. Brace are big and in the way. This is my second pair of Imak gloves. I honestly would kiss the person who invented these. Also they are easy to was and dry. Which is nice when I need to go from making crafts to whisking a cake mix. I do advise you buy these gloves. I worked with wire every day plus housework wearing these gloves. It took 5 months for me to get a tear. They were definitely put the test and I am very impressed. #IMAKCompressiongloves #reesetisha #Reesetishas2cents @reesetisha @imak
customer_reviews.author: Tisha Reese

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, maybe a little snug when bloated. Hard to wear rings with them on. The warning about the potential cancer causing material frightened me a bit. Good value for the price. Seams are a little weak.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi C.

customer_reviews.title: good quality arthritis glove
customer_reviews.text: I have lupus, and sometimes I have arthritis in my hands. I looked at some of the gloves that were on TV for the copper wear, and read the reviews on Amazon and they weren't good. So I looked for a pair of gloves that were rated well on Amazon. These were rated very well. I am very happy with them. I use a pain relief cream at night and put them on only at night. And within a week or two my hands were feeling better. I highly recommend them. They wear well and also washed well. I've had them for about 6 months and they are still in very good condition. They are a good quality glove.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Dzwieleski

customer_reviews.title: finally an arthritis glove that works
customer_reviews.text: had tried the various thumb wraps, but they only supported the basal joint, and were bulky. this supports all thumb joints and provides temperature control in cold weather, plus is thin enough it can be worn under work/gardening gloves without constricting. Hand washing is recommended.. since I only need it on one hand, I turned the other inside out and use as a backup when the other is drying.
customer_reviews.author: D. Steelquist

customer_reviews.title: Quality in the stitching
customer_reviews.text: First off, love these gloves for hand pain/arthritis. The slight increase in heat retention and compression provide relief throughout the day. Sizing is accurate. On to the issue. I have bought three pairs, two of them have stitching issues (see pictures). The stitch was not properly finished causing it to unravel. If this was addressed, product would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I used the measurements chart they provided but the gloves were too big, too long, and did nothing to decrease pain much eliminate it. And apparently when I looked about replacing them with a small pair it's not an item that can be returned!
customer_reviews.author: Nise

customer_reviews.title: These have changed in the last 5 months and NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in Dec. 2018 and they were perfect. I bought again in April 2019 and the sizing is way off. Super tiny. Fabric has changed. Stitching has changed. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go by sizing chart, or buy on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Update: After contacting the company directly, they had me measure CORRECTLY and sent me the size that fits. Do not buy off Amazon...go through the company directly, they will help you size them right, for the same price! Following the sizing chart does not work, and now out the money of these because they aren’t returnable. Would’ve given higher rating if you could return for different size. Buy larger size than you measure.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they're more delicate than is useful
customer_reviews.text: The product is as-described - one pair of fingerless compression gloves. They don't *look* like medical equipment, with a nice, muted-gray fabric that is very breathable and heavy enough to do the work. My rating is because I've had them for all of 18 hours, and upon putting them on for the 2nd time, one of the hand seams split. I wasn't particularly rough with them. . .so, be very gentle, I guess? I'm hoping I can repair them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz P

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite compression gloves. I use them for Reynaud's Syndrome. They have longer fingers which is great because they cover some of that first knuckle too. I feel like many gloves are too short and I end up with pain at the ends of my fingers, but I hate full finger gloves. I will definitely be getting extra pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits under winter gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have RA and my joints ache badly in the winter time. These gloves fit under my winter gloves and provide just the right amount of compression. The size (small) was perfect. Chances are I will buy more pairs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Marques68

customer_reviews.title: perfect size for my hands (XS)) and my hands already ...
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well (snuggly, perfect size for my hands (XS)) and my hands already feel better from having worn them only a week. I like the benefit these gloves have given me. They are already coming apart at the seams, though. after only one week and without having even washed them yet. And they would be better if they had sticky/grippy pads on them. It's not easy to close your hands with these on, so if you're trying to carry something, it's more difficult because the gloves are so slick.
customer_reviews.author: Germanny

customer_reviews.title: Work well and look great.
customer_reviews.text: I have an auto-immune disease that has given me arthritis in many of my joints, including my hands, at the fairly young age of 25. I happen to work with my hands a lot as I am a veterinary technician, so the pain in my hands made it hard for me to do my job, especially when it was chilly or cold outside. My mom got these gloves for me and they not only help with the pain and improve the function of my hands, but I have gotten several compliments from friends, co-workers, & even strangers about them. The look stylish and have become my go-to gloves not only for when my hands are painful, but for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Zeddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleep glove for arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: These are a great sleep glove to put hands in a neutral position. I have rheumatoid arthritis and my hands tend to swell. These help so much to ease the pain. I would recommend for carpel funnel also as I use to type a lot before having to go on disability.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functional, but my left glove came with a hole. More holes developed later
customer_reviews.text: Left glove came with a hole in the outside seams. Otherwise comfortable and functional. Edit:a month later and two washes, four more holes developed. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible for sensory issues
customer_reviews.text: Whoever decided to sew sharp tags inside each of these gloves needs to be fired. I got these to manage my pain, but here I am, trying to get tags out that are sewn in so well that I’m having to do fine detail work with yarn scissors so I don’t accidentally cut holes in the gloves themselves. I shouldn’t have to do this level of labor that is causing me more pain just to make these wearable.
customer_reviews.author: Kae

product_meta.title: IMAK Compression Arthritis Gloves- Premium Arthritic Joint Pain Relief Hand Gloves for Rheumatoid & Osteoarthritis - Ease of Use Seal from Arthritis Foundation,Medium
feature_bullets: ARTHRITIS FOUNDATION EASE OF USE SEAL - The Arthritis Foundation’s Ease of Use Commendation recognizes products proven to make life easier for people who have arthritis and other physical limitations. PREMIUM ARTHRITIS AND CARPAL TUNNEL PAIN RELIEF: IMAK Arthritis Gloves are designed to help relieve aches, pains, and stiffness associated with arthritis of the hands

FEEL THE ALL-DAY DIFFERENCE: Lightweight, breathable cotton-spandex material will allow you to wear the gloves comfortably all day long. The unique design of the IMAK Arthritis Gloves provides mild compression for warmth and helps increase circulation, which ultimately reduces pain and promotes healing

OPEN FINGERTIPS: The open fingertips allow you complete freedom to feel, touch and grip, so you can perform daily tasks without issue. Arthritis Gloves help relieve your pain so you can renew your life
IMAK GUARANTEE: IMAK warrants all products to be free of manufacturing defects. Each product is intended for use by a single patient
